title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 November 2013 - XWiki
content:

10:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> good morning  
10:12 <vmassol> memory looks good so far after my xalan fix of yesterday: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/monitoring?part=graph&graph=usedMemory&period=jour  
10:12 <vmassol> let's wait 1 or 2 more days  
10:13 <thotavrao> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <thotavrao> javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Component manager has not been initialized before lookup for [org.xwiki.model.reference.DocumentReferenceResolver< java.lang.String >] for hint [currentmixed]  
10:14 <DK\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <thotavrao> Can I have any suggestions on this  
10:19 <vmassol> thotavrao: can you pastebin the whole stack trace and let us know what you did to get that  
10:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <thotavrao> vassal, please find here http://pastebin.com/cGYyZb2P  
10:21 <thotavrao> I just deployed xwiki configured with mysql onto WSO2 application server  
10:23 <j-simard> has quit  
10:23 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <DK\_> has left #xwiki  
10:25 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <thotavrao> sorry for typo vmassol  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> hi tmortagne  
10:55 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: Hi  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> Could you tell me where the REST API for WikiManager is used?  
10:55 <tmortagne> I don't think it's used in XE  
10:56 <tmortagne> been introduced by fmancinelli  
10:56 <tmortagne> was not even bundled in XE AFAIK  
10:57 <tmortagne> I mean XEM  
10:59 <thotavrao> hi tmortagne  
10:59 <thotavrao> could you help me with my issue? http://pastebin.com/cGYyZb2P  
11:03 <tmortagne> thotavrao: you sure you don't have anything before that error in the log ?  
11:04 <tmortagne> this error just indicate that something wrong happen when the webapp start  
11:04 <tmortagne> could you put your entire log since the applicationserver started ?  
11:05 <tmortagne> I never used WSO2  
11:05 <tmortagne> so I guess there is some conflict between WSO2 and XWiki dependencies or something like this  
11:06 <tmortagne> it's usually the main cause of trouble between XWiki and an appserver not much tested with it  
11:06 <tmortagne> but you should have error in the log about that  
11:06 <thotavrao> let me check full AS log  
11:15 <tmortagne> I have to go, back in 1h or 2  
11:15 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:23 <thotavrao> tmortagne: Please check this application server log http://pastebin.com/dAmkR7xj  
11:37 <thotavrao> has quit  
11:38 <thotavrao> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <vmassol> guys gdelhumeau needs a least one more full day for RC1 and mflorea still hasn't committed the big indexing change for SOLR so I think we're in bad shape for a RC1 today :(  
11:57 <vmassol> gdelhumeau still has to commit changes to the migrator so this will need heavy retests by sburjan and whoever is available to help  
11:58 <vmassol> (since migrators are always dangerous)  
11:58 <vmassol> Thus we need to postpone RC1 by one day ATM  
11:58 <vmassol> (it was supposed to be today)  
11:58 <sburjan> vmassol: we included a db migrator ?  
11:58 <vmassol> sburjan: yes  
11:58 <sburjan> I didn't know that  
11:59 <sburjan> could you give me a jira link please ?  
11:59 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ?  
11:59 <vmassol> I think the PR was done against the generic jira issue of the new wiki api but would need to be checked,  
12:00 <sburjan> thanks for telling me :)  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> The migrator has to be  changed again before you can test it sburjan  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> the jira is http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9738  
12:00 <sburjan> I'm busy ATM anyway  
12:01 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: but ping me when you have committed it so I can make time  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> ok :)  
12:01 <vmassol> sburjan: it would be good if you could help us do tests tomorrow full day  
12:02 <vmassol> since we're in a big hurry for RC1  
12:02 <vmassol> tomorrow or the day after depending on when gdelhumeau and mflorea push their last commits for RC1  
12:02 <sburjan> okay. I focused more on 5.2.x this week, but by tomorrow I should finish with 5.2.x  
12:03 <vmassol> ok great  
12:03 <sburjan> bbl, lunch  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> the db migrator does change anything in the schema  
12:05 <gdelhumeau> it just convert some objets from an XClass to an other  
12:05 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, i want to display livetable from another space, but using display macro fetches data from current space url, is there any way how to set context to another space?  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> So you just have to test that the configuration (membershipType) is still the same after the upgrade and if the candidacies (join request, invitation, etc) are still there  
12:06 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: it should be the opposite, display uses the context of the page to display and not the context of the current page  
12:06 <vmassol> (while include does the opposite)  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> if a need the programming rights in a page of the UI, I should add an object to that page (RequiredClass)?  
12:07 <vmassol> well normally you shouldn't require PR as much as possible  
12:07 <vmassol> otherwise yes but shouldn't be done lightly  
12:07 <vmassol> it causes a lot of problems  
12:10 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: well, i use it like this {{display reference="xwiki:page.WebHome"/}} , but livetable uses xwiki/wiki/space/ instead of xwiki/bin  
12:13 <vmassol> so you want to display a LT from another wiki?  
12:13 <vmassol> (LT = livetable)  
12:14 <DarkKnightCZ> yes  
12:15 <vmassol> it should work indeed, if not please create a jira issue with an explanation on how to reproduce  
12:16 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, thanks... i just remembered that there is older version of xwiki (5.1), i will try to reproduce it on current version  
12:19 <thotavrao> has left #xwiki  
12:20 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9737 is more complicated than expected  
12:20 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I'm going to move all open issues with component "wiki manager" and "workspaces" to "wiki" in jira, ok?  
12:20 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: yes  
12:21 <gdelhumeau> I have put a comment on the JIRA above  
12:22 <vmassol> done, 46 issues updated  
12:22 <vmassol> now deprecating "workspaces" as component  
12:22 <gdelhumeau> and we need to debate on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9726  
12:34 <vmassol> ouch  
12:34 <vmassol> just built xwiki enterprise  
12:34 <vmassol> and then tried a search  
12:34 <vmassol> I get a velocit macro error with:  
12:34 <vmassol> Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: integrity constraint violation: unique constraint or index violation; SYS\_PK\_10305 table: XWIKIRCS  
12:34 <vmassol> (and the message: "There's no Search UI Extension available in your wiki. Please contact your Administrator.")  
12:35 <vmassol> mflorea: maybe you want to check if you can reproduce  
12:35 <vmassol> strangely I retried and it worked this time  
12:36 <vmassol> spooky  
12:46 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
13:05 <mflorea> vmassol: I need a few hours more for XWIKI-9508, but I'm almost done.  
13:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <thotavrao> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <vmassol> has quit  
13:46 <vmassol1> mflorea: ok cool  
13:57 <thotavrao> hi tmortagne, I am still not able to get running state of xwiki, even using tomcat  
13:57 <sburjan> @devs: can someone put a fixFor 5.2.2 and 5.3 RC1 on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9708 please ?  
13:57 <thotavrao> I am getting different issue this time, http://pastebin.com/JP6CSQmW  
13:58 <tmortagne> thotavrao: http://pastebin.com/JP6CSQmW does not contain the right information, I could need more  
14:00 <tmortagne> s/could/would/  
14:00 <j-simard> has quit  
14:02 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <thotavrao> has left #xwiki  
14:13 <vmassol1> mflorea: how do we configure the search facets? I cannot find how to do that :)  
14:14 <mflorea> vmassol: solrconfig.xml, <!-- Faceting defaults. -->  
14:14 <vmassol1> ah I was looking for a UI :)  
14:15 <vmassol1> I see in the release notes several facets have been improved  
14:15 <mflorea> where did you read that there is an UI?  
14:15 <vmassol1> but I don't get them when I search  
14:15 <vmassol1> is that normal?  
14:15 <vmassol1> well we used to see all facets  
14:15 <vmassol1> and now the only one I see is "Page"  
14:15 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
14:15 <tmortagne> vmassol1: when you upgrade you also need to deleted the solr folder/confiration if it changed or it won't be updated, maybe that's it ?  
14:16 <vmassol> this is a clean wiki  
14:16 <mflorea> facets are displayed based on the results, that's how facets work. i.e. if  all facets are from the same wiki then you won't get the wiki facet, it doesn't make sense to displays a facet with just one value  
14:16 <tmortagne> s/confiration/configuration/  
14:16 <vmassol> built from sources  
14:16 <vmassol> mflorea: for ex I don't get the date facet  
14:16 <vmassol> I searhed for "test"  
14:16 <vmassol> (with one wiki only)  
14:16 <mflorea> how many results do you have?  
14:17 <vmassol> 4  
14:17 <mflorea> 4 results, and they have different date?  
14:17 <vmassol> hmm no same date indeed  
14:17 <mflorea> :)  
14:17 <vmassol> all our default pages have the same date I guess  
14:17 <vmassol> and same for user  
14:17 <vmassol> ok that explains it  
14:17 <vmassol> :)  
14:17 <mflorea> yes, if you have just one user  
14:18 <tmortagne> I don't think all default page have the same date  
14:18 <vmassol> ok I've made one change and I now get all facets  
14:18 <vmassol> cool  
14:18 <tmortagne> s/page/pages/  
14:18 <lucaa> has quit  
14:23 <thotavrao> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <thotavrao> hi tmortagne, what is the required perm size for xwiki, I am getting out of memory error as well with PermGen space  
14:24 <j-simard> has quit  
14:24 <vmassol> thotavrao: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HMemory  
14:25 <tmortagne> thotavrao: groovy and jython create a lot of classes so the default is usually not enough  
14:25 <thotavrao> thanks for pointing me right direction  
14:31 <gdelhumeau> I have commented http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9706  
14:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <lucaa> has quit  
14:52 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <lucaa> has quit  
15:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: I hope you've reviewed the 22 files changed by gdelhumeau ;)  
15:45 <vmassol> I find the unit tests quite lengthy  
15:45 <vmassol> haven't fully reviewed though  
15:45 <tmortagne> lets say I have faith  
15:45 <vmassol> ahah  
15:45 <vmassol> a developer who's faith in other people's code, that's a first :)  
15:45 <vmassol> I don't even have faith in my code!  
15:46 <vmassol> tmortagne: you shouldn't  
15:46 <vmassol> for example:  
15:46 <vmassol> +            logger.warn(String.format("[%s] does not exist", docReference));  
15:46 <vmassol> doesn't look right  
15:46 <vmassol> %s vs {}  
15:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: I have faith in the fact that gdelhumeau will be there to fix any issue  
15:47 <vmassol> nice way out :)  
15:47 <tmortagne> as for your example you are wrong  
15:47 <tmortagne> this is valid, what is not nice is to use String.format where it's useless  
15:48 <vmassol> yes  
15:48 <vmassol> should use slf4j  
15:48 <tmortagne> I guess it's a copy/paste from an exception or something like this  
15:51 <gdelhumeau> no, I didn't know how to use the logger the righr way  
15:51 <gdelhumeau> but now, I know ;)  
15:56 <evalica> has quit  
16:01 <camil7> anyone knows how you can create a stopwikilink comment without a matching startwiklink: in the wysiwyg editor?  Some users here managed to do that but they could not explain how they did it ....  
16:02 <vmassol> what is a stopwikilink comment?  
16:02 <vmassol> :)  
16:02 <vmassol> oh annotated xhtml renderer?  
16:03 <vmassol> no idea, I guess you could check AnnotatedXHTMLRenderer's code to see how it could happen  
16:03 <vmassol> A(nnotatedXHTMLChainingRenderer to be precise)  
16:03 <vmassol> —> AnnotatedXHTMLChainingRenderer  
16:04 <vmassol> and even better: AnnotatedXHTMLLinkRenderer  
16:05 <vmassol> just checked the code and I don't see a way  
16:05 <vmassol> the beginLink() method is in XHTMLChainingRenderer  
16:05 <camil7> ah, ok, it happened when they switch from the WYSIWYG into the preview  
16:06 <vmassol> AnnotatedXHTMLLinkRenderer is called from XHTMLChainingRenderer.beginLink()  
16:06 <vmassol> (and endLink())  
16:06 <vmassol> with this line: this.linkRenderer.beginLink(reference, isFreeStandingURI, parameters);  
16:07 <vmassol> it's going to be hard to find out without an input content  
16:07 <camil7> yes, seems they did some wild copy & paste in the editor ... I cannot reproduce it in any way ...  
16:11 <camil7> I see, this cannot happen to get generated server side, and the WYSIWYG-Editor should either scrap the metadata="..." attribute completely or do not touch it, so "this cannot happen"  
16:13 <camil7> sure enough it is a special IE8 problem ....  
16:24 <Denis> has quit  
16:45 <sburjan> has quit  
16:47 <thotavrao> has quit  
16:51 <thotavrao> has joined #xwiki  
17:00 <camil7> WYSIWYG Editor has no scrollbars in IE 8, even if the text is longer that the editable area.  This seems to be due to a "overflow: visible !important;" rule.  Anyone knows why this is in there ?  
17:02 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
17:27 <camil7> ... and on IE 11 the WYSIWYG editor does not load at all .... well, I guess that is just me, however, must have damaged my installation  
17:30 <camil7> ah, no, that is  XWIKI-9698  
17:31 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki

17:54 <gdelhumeau> and we are looking, with tmortagne, on XWIKI-9733
